summary: The Rim of the Valley Corridor Preservation Act (H.R. 3874) proposes to adjust the boundary of the Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area in California to include the Rim of the Valley Corridor. This expansion aims to preserve the area by incorporating the 'Rim of the Valley Unit,' and ensuring its administration aligns with existing National Recreation Area regulations. The bill also addresses utilities and water resource facilities within the expanded zone, stipulating that activities should minimize environmental impact.
